name: Titanium.UI.iOS.MenuPopup
summary:
A menu popup provides the ability to create custom tooltip options using the items property covering the native UIMenuController class.

See also:

  • iOS Developer Library: UIMenuController

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when the user clicks at one of the menu popup items.
events.description: This event provides the properties title and index which relate to the name and position of the clicked item inside the items property.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Includes options how the menu popup should be hidden. Introduced in SDK 5.2.0.

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: true } (while typically the default for AnimatedOptions is false)

methods.name: isVisible
methods.summary: Indicates whether the menu popup is currently visible.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Includes options how the menu popup should be shown. Note that the default is to be animated.

properties.name: items
properties.description: The items will be shown as soon in the menu popup when the show method is called. To hide them again, use the hide method in conjunction.
